name: Techno Jashan: A Vibrant Celebration of Talent and Creativity
title: Techno Jashan: A Vibrant Celebration of Talent and Creativity
about: Techno Jashan, a cultural extravaganza organized by Guru Nanak College Dehradun, kicked off with a burst of enthusiasm and talent on its first day. The event, held on the 1st of June, 2024, was a melting pot of creativity, showcasing the diverse talents of the college's students.
description: The day started with electrifying dance performances that set the stage on fire. From classical to contemporary, the dancers mesmerized the audience with their skill and passion. The music lovers were treated to soulful singing performances that touched the heart and uplifted the spirit. Adding to the excitement were the captivating fashion walks, where students strutted down the runway with style and confidence. The fashion show was a visual delight, highlighting the creativity and flair of the budding designers. Throughout the day, the atmosphere was filled with energy and excitement, as students and audience members alike were swept away by the talent on display. Whether you're a music lover, a fashion enthusiast, or simply looking for some entertainment, Techno Jashan had something for everyone. As the event unfolds over the coming days, we can expect more unforgettable moments that celebrate the talent and creativity of Guru Nanak College Dehradun's students. Stay tuned for more updates and get ready to be amazed!
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Inter-College Competition
title: Inter-College Competition
about: the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences hosted an exhilarating Inter-College Competition, bringing together talented students from various institutions to showcase their skills and creativity. The college campus buzzed with excitement as participants gathered to compete in a wide range of events spanning academic, cultural, and sports disciplines.
description: The competition featured academic quizzes, debates, and poster presentations, allowing students to demonstrate their knowledge and expertise in their respective fields. Cultural events such as music performances, dance competitions, and art exhibitions added vibrancy to the atmosphere, showcasing the diverse talents of the participants. Sports enthusiasts engaged in friendly matches of cricket, football, and volleyball, fostering camaraderie and sportsmanship. Faculty members and industry professionals served as judges and mentors, providing guidance and encouragement to the participants. The Inter-College Competition was a celebration of talent, creativity, and teamwork, highlighting the spirit of excellence and collaboration that thrives within the academic community.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Visit to Parliament of India
title: Students Experience the Pulse of Indian Democracy
about: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences organized an enlightening visit to the Indian Parliament for its scholars on the 26th of April, 2024. This visit aimed to immerse students in the essence of governance and legislative discourse, thereby recognizing the importance of civic engagement in their holistic development. Nearly all the students from Pharmaceutical department participated in this unique experience.
description: The event was graced by the presence of Mrs. Vineet Arora – COO, Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences. Along with the chief guest, faculty members from Pharmaceutical department were also present to support the students. The visit was designed to ignite a passion for active citizenship and provide firsthand experience of India's democratic processes. The event received positive feedback from both students and faculty members, with many expressing their appreciation for the college's efforts to organize such a captivating and educational visit. Overall, the Parliament visit served its purpose of fostering a sense of civic responsibility and engagement within the college community. In conclusion, this visit was a memorable and inspiring experience for all participants, contributing to their overall understanding of and commitment to active citizenship.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Research seminar on Orientation to Entrepreneurship for Aspiring Pharmacists
title: Research seminar on Orientation to Entrepreneurship for Aspiring Pharmacists
about: The seminar on Orientation to Entrepreneurship for Aspiring Pharmacists was held on 22-03-2024 at Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences, consisting of pharmacy students, recent graduates, and young professionals interested in entrepreneurship within the pharmaceutical domain.
description: The seminar on Orientation to Entrepreneurship for Aspiring Pharmacists successfully achieved its objectives by equipping participants with essential entrepreneurial knowledge, industry insights, and practical skills tailored to their professional aspirations in pharmacy. The event fostered a supportive environment for networking, mentorship, and collaboration among future pharmacist entrepreneurs.
subtitle: Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Colors of Unity: Pre-Holi Celebration
title: Colors of Unity: Pre-Holi Celebration
about: On 23-03-2024, Guru Nanak College in Dehradun came alive with the vibrant colors of Holi as students and faculty joined together for a joyous pre-Holi celebration. The campus was transformed into a kaleidoscope of hues, echoing with laughter, showcasing the unity and spirit of the college community.
description: The event was a true reflection of the college's ethos, where diversity is celebrated, and bonds are strengthened through shared experiences. Students and faculty alike participated in the festivities with great enthusiasm, embracing the joyous atmosphere and spreading the message of harmony and togetherness. From traditional music and dance performances to colorful rangoli and food stalls, every aspect of the celebration was meticulously planned to ensure a memorable experience for everyone. Students had the opportunity to not only enjoy the festivities but also learn about the cultural significance of Holi and its importance in Indian tradition. The highlight of the event was the spirit of inclusivity and unity that permeated throughout the campus. Regardless of background or beliefs, everyone came together as one big family, united by the joyous spirit of Holi. In conclusion, the pre-Holi celebration at Guru Nanak College was a resounding success, showcasing the rich cultural heritage of India and fostering a sense of unity and togetherness among the college community. It was a day filled with joy, laughter, and colorful memories that will be cherished for years to come.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: National Workshop
title: National Workshop
about: the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences hosted a National Workshop  on the 14th of march that brought together scholars, industry experts, and students for a day of intensive learning and collaboration. The workshop focused on recent advancements in pharmaceutical sciences and their applications. The college campus was bustling with activity as participants from various institutions gathered to exchange knowledge and ideas.
description: The event featured keynote addresses by prominent researchers, interactive sessions, and hands-on demonstrations of cutting-edge technologies. Workshops were conducted on topics such as drug development, biotechnology, and regulatory affairs, providing attendees with valuable insights and practical skills. Poster presentations and networking sessions allowed students to showcase their research and connect with professionals in their field. Nearly all students from the Pharmaceutical department participated, reflecting their eagerness to engage with the latest developments in their discipline. The National Workshop was a tremendous success, fostering a collaborative environment that encouraged innovation, professional growth, and a deeper understanding of pharmaceutical sciences.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: World Glaucoma week
title: World Glaucoma week
about: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences organized an enlightening visit to the Indian Parliament for its scholars on the 10th of March, 2024. This visit aimed to immerse students in the essence of governance and legislative discourse, thereby recognizing the importance of civic engagement in their holistic development. Nearly all the students from Pharmaceutical department participated in this unique experience.
description: The event was graced by the presence of Mrs. Vineet Arora – COO, Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences. Along with the chief guest, faculty members from Pharmaceutical department were also present to support the students. The visit was designed to ignite a passion for active citizenship and provide firsthand experience of India's democratic processes. The event received positive feedback from both students and faculty members, with many expressing their appreciation for the college's efforts to organize such a captivating and educational visit. Overall, the Parliament visit served its purpose of fostering a sense of civic responsibility and engagement within the college community. In conclusion, this visit was a memorable and inspiring experience for all participants, contributing to their overall understanding of and commitment to active citizenship.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Women's Day Celebration
title: Women's Day Celebration
about: the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences celebrated International Women’s Day On the 8th of March with great enthusiasm and reverence. The event was dedicated to honoring the achievements and contributions of women in various fields. The college campus was adorned with banners and posters highlighting the theme of gender equality and women's empowerment.
description: The celebration began with an inspiring keynote speech by a renowned female leader, emphasizing the importance of women's rights and equality. This was followed by a series of activities, including panel discussions, workshops on women’s health and career development, and cultural performances showcasing the talents of female students. An exhibition was also organized, displaying the accomplishments of women scientists, entrepreneurs, and leaders. Nearly all students, along with faculty members, participated actively, reflecting the collective commitment to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment. The Women’s Day celebration was a resounding success, reinforcing the values of respect, equality, and empowerment, and contributing to the holistic development of students by promoting awareness and appreciation of gender issues.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Science Exhibition
title: Science Exhibition
about: On the 26th of April, the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences hosted a dynamic Science Exhibition, showcasing the innovative spirit and scientific curiosity of its students. The college campus was abuzz with excitement as students from the Pharmaceutical department and other disciplines presented their research projects and experiments.
description: The exhibition featured a diverse range of displays, including cutting-edge pharmaceutical research, sustainable energy solutions, and advanced medical technologies. Faculty members and industry experts evaluated the projects, providing valuable feedback and encouragement to the young scientists. Interactive sessions and live demonstrations captivated the audience, highlighting the practical applications of scientific principles. This event not only provided a platform for students to exhibit their work but also fostered a collaborative environment for the exchange and development of ideas. Nearly all students from the Pharmaceutical department participated, demonstrating their commitment to scientific inquiry and innovation. The Science Exhibition was a resounding success, inspiring students to pursue excellence in their fields and contributing to their holistic development through experiential learning.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Research seminar on Introduction to IP Rights: Key Concepts and Applications
title: Research seminar on Introduction to IP Rights: Key Concepts and Applications
about: The seminar on Introduction to IP Rights: Key Concepts and Applications was conducted successfully on 30-01-2024. The event gathered 59 students from department of pharmaceutical science.
description: The seminar on Introduction to IP Rights: Key Concepts and Applications achieved its objectives by equipping participants with essential knowledge and practical insights into intellectual property. It underscored the critical role of IP rights in fostering innovation, protecting creativity, and driving economic development across industries.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Happy Republic Day
title: Happy Republic Day
about: On the 26th of January, 2024, the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences celebrated Republic Day with immense pride and patriotic fervor. The college campus was adorned with the tricolor decorations, and the air resonated with patriotic songs. The event commenced with the hoisting of the national flag, followed by the singing of the national anthem, evoking a sense of unity and national pride.
description: The celebration featured inspiring speeches by faculty members, highlighting the importance of the day and the values enshrined in the Constitution. Students showcased their talents through cultural performances, including traditional dances and patriotic songs, emphasizing the diversity and unity of the nation. Additionally, a special exhibition was organized, displaying projects and artworks created by students that depicted India's rich heritage and achievements. Nearly all students from the Pharmaceutical department participated, reflecting their respect for the nation and their commitment to civic engagement. The Republic Day celebration was a profound reminder of the importance of democracy, freedom, and responsibility, instilling a sense of national pride and unity among the students.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Happy Lohri
title: Happy Lohri
about: On the 14th of January, 2024, the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences celebrated Lohri with vibrant enthusiasm and cultural richness. The college courtyard was transformed into a festive arena, beautifully decorated with traditional Punjabi motifs and filled with the joyous sounds of folk music. Central to the celebration was the lighting of a grand bonfire, around which students gathered to offer peanuts, popcorn, sesame seeds, and jaggery, symbolizing gratitude and the end of winter.
description: The event was marked by lively Bhangra and Gidda performances, accompanied by the rhythmic beats of the dhol, which enlivened the atmosphere and encouraged everyone to participate. Traditional Punjabi delicacies such as makki di roti and sarson da saag were served, enhancing the festive spirit with authentic flavors. Stories and legends, including the tale of Dulla Bhatti, were shared, enriching the cultural experience and connecting students with the festival's historical significance. Nearly all students from the Pharmaceutical department took part, fostering a sense of unity and cultural appreciation. The Lohri celebration was a memorable event, highlighting the importance of cultural traditions in enriching student life and contributing to their holistic development.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Research seminar on Exploring R&D Applications in the Agri-Pharma Sector
title: Research seminar on Exploring R&D Applications in the Agri-Pharma Sector
about: The Exploring R&D Applications in the Agri-Pharma Sector research seminar held on 20-12-2023 at Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences brought together a diverse group of researchers, scientists, and industry leaders interested in exploring the potential of agricultural resources in pharmaceutical R&D.
description: The Exploring R&D Applications in the Agri-Pharma Secto research seminar successfully achieved its objectives by providing a platform for knowledge exchange, collaborative discussions, and exploration of innovative R&D applications. Participants gained valuable insights into emerging trends and opportunities in leveraging agricultural resources for pharmaceutical advancements.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Research Seminar on Analysing Patents: Skills Workshop
title: Research Seminar on Analysing Patents: Skills Workshop
about: The Analysing Patents: Skills Workshop research seminar held on 13-10-2023 at Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences gathered professionals, researchers, and students interested in mastering the art of patent analysis in pharmaceutical and biotechnological sectors.
description: The Analysing Patents: Skills Workshop research seminar successfully achieved its objectives by equipping participants with practical skills, knowledge, and tools essential for effective patent analysis in pharmaceutical and biotechnological domains. Attendees gained valuable insights and enhanced their professional capabilities in intellectual property management and innovation strategy.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Research Horizons: India and International Perspectives
title: Research Horizons: India and International Perspectives
about: The Research Horizons: India and International Perspectives event held on 26-09-2023 at Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences brought together a diverse group of researchers, scholars, and industry experts to explore and discuss research advancements from both Indian and global perspectives.
description: The Research Horizons: India and International Perspectives event was a resounding success, achieving its objectives of promoting cross-cultural understanding, facilitating knowledge exchange, and strengthening collaborative efforts in research and development. The event not only provided valuable insights into global research trends but also inspired participants to explore new avenues for research excellence and innovation.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Research seminar on Exploring Strategies for Designing Next-Generation Medications
title: Research seminar on Exploring Strategies for Designing Next-Generation Medications
about: On 19th September 2023, Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences hosted a dynamic research seminar titled Exploring Strategies for Designing Next-Generation Medications. The seminar aimed to delve into innovative approaches and methodologies crucial for advancing the field of pharmaceutical sciences.
description: The seminar on Exploring Strategies for Designing Next-Generation Medications proved to be an enriching experience for all attendees. It provided a platform for learning, sharing, and envisioning future advancements in pharmaceutical sciences. The insights gained from this seminar are expected to catalyse further research initiatives at Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences, contributing to the development of innovative medications that enhance patient care globally.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Poster Presentation
title: Poster Presentation
about: On August 25, 2023, Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences organized a Poster Presentation Event, providing a platform for students to showcase their innovative projects. The event aimed to foster academic excellence, and promote scholarly communication among students and faculty members.The event venue was arranged with display boards and stands to accommodate the presentation of posters. Each participant was assigned a designated space to showcase their poster, along with accompanying materials such as charts, graphs, and visual aids to illustrate their research findings effectively. Participants had the opportunity to present their research posters on various topics related to pharmaceutical sciences, including drug discovery, pharmacology, pharmaceutical technology, and clinical pharmacy.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences
description: A diverse range of research topics were presented during the event, covering areas such as novel drug delivery systems, pharmacological mechanisms of action, therapeutic efficacy of pharmaceutical compounds, and clinical outcomes of patient interventions. Participants explored current trends and challenges in pharmaceutical research and proposed innovative solutions to address them. A panel of faculty members and experts in pharmaceutical sciences evaluated the poster presentations based on criteria such as scientific merit, clarity of presentation, originality of research, and depth of understanding. Participants were given the opportunity to present their posters and engage in discussions with the evaluators to further elaborate on their research findings. The Event facilitated knowledge sharing and participants exchanged ideas, insights, and feedback on their projects, fostering interdisciplinary collaboration and stimulating intellectual discourse within the college community.Outstanding poster presentations were recognized and awarded based on merit and innovation. Participants who demonstrated exceptional research skills, creativity, and scientific consistency were acknowledged for their contributions. Certificates were presented to winners during a closing ceremony, honouring their achievements and inspiring others to pursue excellence in research

name: Hospital Visit 2023 - CMI
title: Hospital Visit 2023 - CMI
about: The visit to CMI Hospital organized by the Pharmacy Department of Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences on August 17, 2023, was a valuable learning experience for students, providing them with first-hand exposure to hospital pharmacy practices and interdisciplinary healthcare collaboration. It allowed students to gain practical insights into the role of pharmacists in patient care and medication management within a clinical setting, further enriching their education and preparing them for future careers in pharmacy practice.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences
description: Throughout the visit, students were immersed in the bustling environment of a clinical setting, where they witnessed firsthand the pivotal role pharmacists play in patient care and medication management. By shadowing seasoned professionals and engaging in interactive sessions, they gained practical insights into the multifaceted responsibilities of pharmacists within the healthcare ecosystem. The experience not only broadened their academic horizons but also equipped them with tangible skills and knowledge essential for their future endeavors in pharmacy practice. Interactions with healthcare professionals facilitated a comprehensive understanding of collaborative approaches to patient care, emphasizing the crucial interplay between various healthcare disciplines. Overall, the visit to CMI Hospital served as a catalyst for the holistic development of the students, empowering them with the confidence and expertise needed to navigate the intricacies of contemporary pharmacy practice. It underscored the significance of experiential learning in augmenting traditional classroom education, thereby preparing them for the challenges and opportunities that lie ahead in their careers.

name: Dengue awareness Rally
title: Dengue awareness Rally
about: The Dengue Awareness Rally organized by NSS section of Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences in Jhajra was a commendable initiative aimed at raising awareness about dengue fever and promoting preventive measures. Through the rally, participants effectively disseminated information to the community, empowering them to take proactive steps to prevent the spread of dengue. The event exemplified the college's commitment to community health and disease prevention, and it highlighted the importance of collective action in combating public health challenges like dengue fever.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences
description: The rally saw enthusiastic participation from students, faculty, and members of the local community. As the procession wound its way through the streets, participants distributed informational pamphlets and engaged in conversations with residents, emphasizing the importance of maintaining clean surroundings, eliminating breeding sites for mosquitoes, and seeking timely medical attention in case of symptoms. The event not only educated the community about the dangers of dengue but also empowered them with practical knowledge to protect themselves and their families. It exemplified the college's commitment to community health and disease prevention, demonstrating the role of educational institutions in addressing public health challenges. By mobilizing collective action and fostering community participation, the Dengue Awareness Rally served as a shining example of proactive efforts to combat diseases and promote well-being.

name: Research workshop on Systematic Approach to Pharmaceutical Care
title: Research workshop on Systematic Approach to Pharmaceutical Care
about: The Workshop on Systematic Approach to Pharmaceutical Care held at the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences on July 25, 2023, was facilitated by Ms. Bhawna Bora for B.Pharm students. With over 80 participants, the workshop aimed to impart practical skills and insights into patient-centered pharmacy practice. Through structured sessions, case-based learning, role-playing exercises, and interactive discussions, students gained valuable knowledge and competencies essential for delivering effective pharmaceutical care. The workshop successfully achieved its objectives, providing a platform for professional development and preparing students for their future roles as competent pharmacists.
description: The Workshop on Systematic Approach to Pharmaceutical Care, organized by the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences and facilitated by Ms. Bhawna Bora, was highly successful in achieving its objectives. Through structured sessions, case-based learning, role-playing exercises, and interactive discussions, students gained valuable insights and practical skills essential for delivering patient-centered pharmaceutical care. The workshop served as a platform for fostering professional development and preparing students for their future roles as competent and compassionate pharmacists.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Research Seminar on How to Design Future Medicines
title: Research Seminar on How to Design Future Medicines
about: The Research Seminar on How to Design Future Medicines, conducted by Ms. Kriti Dabral on behalf of the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences Dehradun (GNC), took place on July 8, 2023.
description: The Research Seminar on How to Design Future Medicines, organized by the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences Dehradun (GNC) and led by Ms. Kriti Dabral, went out to be a very successful one. The event effectively fulfilled its objectives of educating B.Pharm students about the details of pharmaceutical research and inspiring them to contribute to the development of future medicines. With its informative sessions and interactive discussions, the seminar proved to be a valuable learning experience for all attendees.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Yoga Day 2023
title: Yoga Day 2023
about: Yoga Day 2023 was celebrated with great fervor and enthusiasm at Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences on June 21, 2023. The event aimed to promote the ancient practice of yoga and its numerous benefits for physical, mental, and spiritual well-being. The event commenced with invigorating yoga sessions led by experienced instructors. Participants engaged in various yoga asanas (postures) and pranayama (breathing exercises) to rejuvenate their mind and body. Renowned yoga experts were invited to deliver enlightening lectures on the significance of yoga in modern-day life. They emphasized the importance of incorporating yoga into daily routines for stress management and holistic health.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences
description: Live demonstrations of advanced yoga poses were conducted to inspire participants to explore the depths of their physical capabilities and enhance their yoga practice.Interactive workshops were organized to educate attendees about the therapeutic aspects of yoga and its potential in alleviating common health issues such as anxiety, insomnia, and back pain. The event also included guided meditation sessions to cultivate inner peace and mindfulness among participants. Meditation is an integral aspect of yoga practice, promoting mental clarity and emotional balance. To add a touch of cultural richness to the event, traditional Indian dance and music performances were showcased, highlighting the spiritual essence of yoga. The event witnessed enthusiastic participation from students, faculty members, and staff, reflecting the growing interest in yoga among the college community. Participants expressed deep appreciation for the opportunity to learn and experience the transformative power of yoga firsthand. Positive feedback was received regarding the organization and execution of the event, indicating its success in achieving its objectives. Yoga Day 2023 at Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences was a resounding success, fostering a deeper understanding and appreciation for yoga as a holistic practice for physical, mental, and spiritual well-being. The event served as a reminder of the timeless wisdom of yoga and its relevance in the modern world.

name: Research Seminar on Advances in Pharmaceutical Technology
title: Research Seminar on Advances in Pharmaceutical Technology
about: The seminar commenced with an opening address by Mrs. Yashika Uniyal, highlighting the significance of staying updated with the latest developments in pharmaceutical technology for aspiring pharmacists. This was followed by the keynote speech delivered by Kriti Dabral, wherein she shared her insights into emerging trends and future prospects in the field.
description: Overall, the Research Seminar on Advances in Pharmaceutical Technology proved to be a resounding success, achieving its objectives of educating, inspiring, and empowering B.Pharm students to excel in their academic and professional pursuits. The event concluded with a vote of thanks, expressing gratitude to the speakers, organizers, and participants for their contributions towards making the seminar a memorable and enriching experience.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Seminar on Importance of Pharmaco-economics in Pharma research
title: Seminar on Importance of Pharmaco-economics in Pharma research
about: The Seminar on Importance of Pharmaco-economics in Pharma research, spearheaded by Dr. Mohit Gupta on behalf of the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences, was held on January 17, 2023. The seminar focused on enlightening B. Pharm students about the crucial role of pharmaco-economics in shaping pharmaceutical research and healthcare policies.
description: The Seminar on Importance of Pharmaco-economics in Pharma research, organized by the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences and led by Dr. Mohit Gupta, successfully achieved its objectives of educating B. Pharm students about the significance of pharmaco-economics. Through expert presentations, and interactive discussions students gained valuable insights into how economic principles influence pharmaceutical research and healthcare decision-making. The seminar served as a valuable platform for students to broaden their understanding and appreciation of the interdisciplinary nature of pharmaceutical sciences.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Research Methodology Workshop on Drug Discovery
title: Research Methodology Workshop on Drug Discovery
about: The Research Methodology Workshop on Drug Discovery was conducted by the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences on January 16, 2023 led by Mrs. Yashika Uniyal, the workshop aimed to enhance the research skills of B.Pharm students in the field of drug discovery. With a participation of over 100 students, the workshop provided valuable insights and practical knowledge on research methodologies pertinent to pharmaceutical science.
description: The Research Methodology Workshop on Drug Discovery, conducted by the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences and led by Mrs. Yashika Uniyal, was a resounding success. The workshop effectively fulfilled its objectives of enhancing the research skills and knowledge of B.Pharm students in the field of drug discovery. With its expert guidance, interactive sessions, practical demonstrations, and networking
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Seminar on Entrepreneurship Development
title: Seminar on Entrepreneurship Development
about: The Seminar on Entrepreneurship Development commenced with an opening address by the organizing committee, emphasizing the importance of entrepreneurship in driving innovation, economic growth, and job creation in the pharmaceutical sector. The event featured a series of interactive sessions, presentations, and panel discussions led by Mr. Saithjeet Arora and faculty members, covering various aspects of entrepreneurship.
description: Moreover, the seminar facilitated networking opportunities, allowing students to connect with industry professionals and fellow peers interested in entrepreneurship. The event concluded with a closing remark, expressing gratitude to the speakers, organizers, and participants for their contributions and active involvement in making the seminar a success.In summary, the Seminar on Entrepreneurship Development served as a platform for B.Pharm students to explore and embrace the entrepreneurial mindset, acquire essential skills and knowledge, and gain inspiration from industry leaders and successful entrepreneurs. The event provided a valuable learning experience and laid the groundwork for students to pursue entrepreneurial ventures and make meaningful contributions to the pharmaceutical industry.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Seminar on Research on Evidence-Based Medicine
title: Seminar on Research on Evidence-Based Medicine
about: The Seminar on Research on Evidence-Based Medicine, organized by the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences, took place on December 1, 2022. The seminar focused on educating B.Pharm students about the significance of evidence-based medicine in healthcare and the role of research in generating reliable evidence to inform clinical practice.
description: The Seminar on Research on Evidence-Based Medicine, conducted by the Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences and led by Ms. Kriti Dabral, was highly successful in achieving its objectives. Through expert presentations, case studies, interactive discussions, and a large turnout of participants, the seminar provided B. Pharm students with valuable insights into the principles and practices of evidence-based medicine. It inspired students to recognize the importance of research in informing clinical decision-making and motivated them to actively engage in research activities to contribute to evidence-based healthcare.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Research Seminar on Advances in Biotechnology
title: Research Seminar on Advances in Biotechnology
about: The Research Seminar on Advances in Biotechnology commenced with an opening address by the organizing committee, highlighting the significance of biotechnology in advancing healthcare and pharmaceutical research. The event featured presentations, lectures, and interactive sessions led by renowned researchers, faculty members, and industry experts, covering various topics.
description: The sessions were designed to provide students with a comprehensive overview of the latest advancements and emerging trends in biotechnology, as well as to encourage critical thinking and discussion on the ethical and societal implications of biotechnological innovations. Students actively engaged in discussions, asked questions, and shared their insights and perspectives on the topics discussed.Moreover, the seminar provided networking opportunities for students to interact with speaker Mrs. Yashika Uniyal, faculty members, and peers interested in biotechnology. Attendees had the chance to exchange ideas, collaborate on research projects, and explore potential career paths in the field of biotechnology.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Workshop on Patent Search and Analysis
title: Workshop on Patent Search and Analysis
about: The Workshop on Patent Search and Analysis commenced with an introductory session wherein the importance of patent searching and analysis in pharmaceutical sciences was emphasized. The event featured interactive presentations, demonstrations, and practical exercises led by experienced faculty members.
description: Moreover, the workshop facilitated peer-to-peer learning and collaboration, allowing students to exchange ideas, share experiences, and discuss challenges encountered during patent searching and analysis. The event concluded with a closing remark, expressing gratitude to the speakers, organizers, and participants for their active involvement and contributions towards making the workshop a success.
subtitle: The Guru Nanak College of Pharmaceutical Sciences

name: Workshop on the Use of Patent Information Systems for the Promotion of Innovation
title: Workshop on the Use of Patent Information Systems for the Promotion of Innovation
about: The Workshop on the “Use of Patent Information Systems for the Promotion of Innovation” commenced with an introductory session highlighting the role of patents as a catalyst for innovation in the pharmaceutical sector. The event featured interactive presentations, demonstrations, and practical exercises led by experienced faculty members and industry professionals.
description: In summary, the Workshop on the Use of Patent Information Systems for the Promotion of Innovation proved to be a valuable learning experience for B.Pharm students, equipping them with essential skills, knowledge, and resources to harness the power of patent information for driving innovation and making strategic decisions in the pharmaceutical sector. The event inspired students to embrace innovation, protect intellectual property, and contribute to the advancement of pharmaceutical sciences through cutting-edge research and development initiatives.
